intro: Tithymalus pseudoapios, commonly known as the false senna, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in clusters. Its seed pods are elongated and contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Tithymalus pseudoapios is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
